data.name: ADVANCED_HVAC_CONTENT
data.value:
For candidates who have completed our Introduction to HVAC systems course we offer a more advanced program. We will build on your existing knowledge and experience to develop your fault finding and maintenance skills.

Topics covered include HVAC Design, heating and ventilation loads, psychrometrics, Absorbtion systems, VRF Systems, principles of Chillers, maintenance, energy efficiency, humidity control and legislation.

data.name: ADVANCED_HVAC_TITLE
data.value: Advanced H.V.A.C. and Process Cooling Systems

data.name: BESPOKE_SERVICES_CONTENT
data.value:
Every refrigeration or air-conditioning system is different. Here at ECAC we understand that an off the shelf course will not suit everybody’s requirements and therefore we will design and deliver training to suit your unique requirements.

We will visit your site to discuss your requirements and examine your refrigeration or Air-conditioning equipment. We will produce a first draft training outline which will be issued to you for approval. When the content has been agreed we will produce all the course materials specifically designed to suit your requirements.

Sometimes it is difficult to arrange training due to shift patterns. At ECAC will work around your staff availability, be that during the day, in the evening or at weekends.

data.name: BESPOKE_SERVICES_TITLE
data.value: Tailored Course Design and Needs Analysis

data.name: EMPLOYABILITY_SERVICES_CONTENT
data.value:
ECAC has a reputation for innovation and responsiveness to the requirements of Industry and the employees of Industry. We are aware that the days of a ‘job for life’ are a thing of the past and whether it be through choice or circumstances many people will change their job or employer many times over their lifetime.

We have developed a range of services designed to meet the requirements of our clients who are dealing with a career change or are in the process of helping their employees to prepare for a change of employer.

Career Guidance

Our career guidance expert, Dr. Brian Staines, has over 30 years’ experience in career guidance and employability. Brian works with both groups and individuals in order to identify future career opportunities and options based on both the individuals past experience and qualifications and their ambitions for the future.

Typically, Dr. Staines works with groups from companies currently dealing with redundancies to help their employees identify and prepare for opportunities in the future. The typical career guidance seminar will commence with a group session where the relevant staff members will participate in an employability workshop both to identify current skills and future ones that they would wish to develop. On completion of this seminar, Dr. Staines will work with individuals to discuss and advise on the specifics of their situation and drawing up a positive action plan for future activities.

Curriculum Vitae Writing Service

In conjunction with our Language and Communication specialist,, Mr Robert Howe MA, and Dr Staines, each participant will be given the opportunity to develop a curriculum vitae to current international standards. The clients will be helped to develop a C.V. which emphasises their skills and experience, as well as their employability. Rob will concentrate on the use of language and syntax, while Brian will concentrate on developing the specific information to be used in the C.V.

International CV’s

As part of our translation services, we can also provide you with a C.V. in German. However, unlike a direct translation service, we will develop your C.V. specifically for the American, German or Middle Eastern jobs market.

data.name: EMPLOYABILITY_SERVICES_TITLE
data.value: Career Services

data.name: FGAS_CAT1_CONTENT
data.value:
The purpose of this qualification is to certify that successful candidates are competent to carry out leak checking, recovery, installation, service and maintenance of stationary refrigeration, air conditioning and heat-pump equipment that contains refrigerants which are classified as either fluorinated (F) gases or ozone depleting substances (ODS) regardless of the quantity of refrigerant.

This level is generally required by technicians and engineers working on commercial refrigeration and heat pump systems. The course and assessment assume that the candidate has a high level of prior knowledge and experience on refrigeration and heat pump systems.

The assessment consists of an online assessment which will assess both the technical and Legislative knowledge of the candidate and a practical assessment covering brazing, strength testing, leak checking, charging, commissioning and recovering refrigerant and oil.

data.name: FGAS_CAT1_TITLE
data.value: City & Guilds 2079 Category 1

data.name: FGAS_CAT2_CONTENT
data.value:
The purpose of this qualification is to certify that successful candidates are competent to carry out leak checking, recovery, installation, service and maintenance of stationary refrigeration, air conditioning and heat-pump equipment that contains refrigerants which are classified as either fluorinated (F) gases or ozone depleting substances (ODS) containing less than 5 tons CO2 equivalent of an F gas refrigerant. The quantity of refrigerant varies depending on the global warming potential (GWP) of the refrigerant.

This level is generally required by technicians and engineers working on domestic refrigerators and AC units and small commercial systems.

The assessment consists of an online assessment which will assess both the technical and Legislative knowledge of the candidate and a practical assessment covering brazing, strength testing, leak checking, charging, commissioning and recovering refrigerant and oil.

data.name: FGAS_CAT2_TITLE
data.value: City & Guilds 2079 Category 2

data.name: FGAS_CAT3_CONTENT
data.value:
The purpose of this qualification is to certify that successful candidates are competent to carry out recovery on stationary refrigeration, air conditioning and heat-pump equipment that contains refrigerants which are classified as either fluorinated (F) gases or ozone depleting substances (ODS) containing less than 5 tons CO2 equivalent of an F gas refrigerant. The quantity of refrigerant varies depending on the global warming potential (GWP) of the refrigerant.

This level is generally required by technicians operating in recycling centres.

The assessment consists of an online assessment which will assess both the technical and Legislative knowledge of the candidate and a practical assessment.

data.name: FGAS_CAT3_TITLE
data.value: City & Guilds 2079 Category 3

data.name: FGAS_CAT4_CONTENT
data.value:
The purpose of this qualification is to certify that successful candidates are competent to carry out non-intrusive leak checking, of stationary refrigeration, air conditioning and heat-pump equipment that contains refrigerants which are classified as either fluorinated (F) gases or ozone depleting substances (ODS) This level is generally required by technicians and engineers who wish to record leak checks.

The assessment consists of an online assessment which will assess both the technical and Legislative knowledge of the candidate and a practical assessment covering leak checking.

data.name: FGAS_CAT4_TITLE
data.value: City & Guilds 2079 Category 4

data.name: FGAS_OVERVIEW_CONTENT
data.value:
ECAC offers the full range of City & Guilds 2079 F Gas training and certification. We are the main provider of these qualifications in the Irish market and have been offering City & Guilds qualifications for over 10 years There are four categories in F Gas, from category 4 which allows candidates to leak test systems through to category 1 which qualifies technicians to undertake leak checking, recovery, installation, service and maintenance of equipment on any quantity of HFC refrigerant.

At ECAC we offer all levels of City & Guilds certification and in addition we also offer our Intensive F Gas course. This course is aimed at technicians dealing with refrigeration and air-conditioning equipment on a regular basis but due to the nature of their work, do not have exposure to all of the elements necessary to complete the City & Guilds 2079 F gas assessment. The training is a blend of theory, practical and sample assessments over four days, followed by the F Gas assessment on day five.

data.name: FGAS_OVERVIEW_TITLE
data.value: City & Guilds 2079 (F Gas) Qalifications

data.name: HVAC_INTRO_CONTENT
data.value:
HVAC (Heating, Ventilation & Air Conditioning) systems are a part of most commercial or Industrial buildings. Whether it is designed to provide a comfortable environment for staff or as a requirement for a manufacturing process its correct maintenance is vital in order to keep productivity and quality levels to an acceptable level.

This course is designed to give your maintenance and facilities staff an insight into the operation of HVAC systems and the maintenance procedures required to keep your system operating at its optimum level.

data.name: HVAC_INTRO_TITLE
data.value: Introduction to HVAC Systems (3 Day)

data.name: REFRIG_ADVANCED_CONTENT
data.value:
For candidates who have completed our Introduction to Refrigeration course we offer a more advanced program. We will build on your existing knowledge and experience to develop your fault finding and maintenance skills.

This course includes an opportunity for candidates to install, commission and decommission a working vapour compression system under supervision and takes an in depth look at a variety of vapour compression systems.

data.name: REFRIG_ADVANCED_TITLE
data.value: Advanced Refrigeration Maintenance and Fault finding (3 Days)

data.name: REFRIG_AMMONIA_CONTENT
data.value:
Our one day on site toolbox talk on R717 (Anhydrous Ammonia) safety course is designed for all personnel who may come into contact with Anhydrous Ammonia refrigerant in the work place. It is designed to make all participants aware of the risks and safety procedures involved in handling R717.

Typical candidates for this course are maintenance and warehouse staff working in Cold stores or with plant using R717 as well as emergency response team members.

data.name: REFRIG_AMMONIA_TITLE
data.value: R717 Ammonia Safety Workshop (1 Day)

data.name: REFRIG_INTRO_CONTENT
data.value:
When you enrol on a Basic Refrigeration & Air Conditioning program at ECAC, you will receive the training and knowledge necessary to understand the operation and function of the major components of the system and how to carry out basic maintenance and fault finding.

The course is designed for tradesmen and technicians whose duties put them in contact with refrigeration and HVAC plant.

The course will covers a wide variety of topics selected to ensure that participants will gain knowledge on a wide variety of systems.

data.name: REFRIG_INTRO_TITLE
data.value: Introduction to Refrigeration (3 Days)

data.name: REFRIG_LIQUID_CONTENT
data.value:
Designed for candidates working with Industrial refrigeration systems but without any formal training in this area but have a good working knowledge or have completed an Introduction to Refrigeration training program.

Liquid overfeed systems are typically used in the Food processing, Brewing and Pharmaceuticals industries and in Ireland typically use Ammonia as a refrigerant. The course covers all of the major components, systems and operations including evaporative condensers and cooling towers.

data.name: REFRIG_LIQUID_TITLE
data.value: Liquid Overfeed Systems (3 Day)
